items.name: Aliette WP 80
items.description:
Aliette is a trusted and well-known Highly Systemic fungicide against Plasmopara, Phytophthora, Bremia mainly for Citrus, vegetables, grapes and strawberries.

- It works both directly on the fungus and indirectly, by stimulating the plant’s natural defences – a unique mode of action resulting in an extremely low risk of resistance.
- It is highly systemic, travelling both up and down the plant.
- It meets food-chain requirements.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.
How to apply:
Foliar application.

Formulation:
Aliette 80 WP is wettable powder containing 800g a.i. / kg Fostyl –Al.

Mode of action:
When applied as a preventative treatment, Product inhibiting spore germination and the penetration of the pathogen into the plant or blocks mycelial development and sporulation, in the case of a curative treatment the product slows down sufficiently the invasion of the pathogen, by reinforcing the natural defensive reactions of the plants and subsequently enabling the host's hypersensitive physical response to localize or seal-off the invading organism.

items.name: Alsystin SC 480
items.description:
Alsystin is a non-systemic Insect Growth Regulator (IGR) for integrated pest control, especially in fruit, citrus, and vegetables. Alsystin is mainly active against phytophagous chewing insects such as caterpillars, orthopterans (locusts, grasshoppers and crickets) .It has a completely different mode of action compared to other insecticides. It acts on the larval stages being able to moult.

Formulation:
Alsystin 480 SC is a suspension concentrate containing 480 g a.i. /l Triflumuron.

Mode of action:
Triflumuron inhibits the chitin synthesis in insect-larvae and has no knock-down effect against adult insects. It easily adsorbs to waxy layers of the cuticles and possesses therefore a very good rain-stability.

items.name: Antracol WP 70
items.description:
Antracol is a broad spectrum contact fungicide with protective action. The active substance of Antracol belongs to the group of dithiocarbamate fungicides. It affects several sites in the metabolism of fungal cells.  Antracol is registered to more than 80 countries with the next main uses:
 - Late blight of potato (Phytophthora infestans). 
- Early blight of potato and tomato (Alternaria solani).
 - Downy mildew in grapevine (Plasmopara viticola).
 - Apple scab (Venturia inaequalis). 
-Black Sigatoka in banana (Mycosphaerella fijiensis).
 Antracol is an important source zinc supply in case of deficiency for many crops and exhibits excellent phyto-compatibility for various crops, also in early development stages. Antracol is indispensable in anti-resistance strategies due to its special mode of action. Because it affects several sites in the metabolism of fungal cells, there is little danger of resistance developing – resistance to Antracol has not yet observed. This makes it the ideal partner for alternation with sprays of other fungicides, or for tank-mixtures.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
foliar application For Vegetables use 600-800 lit /ha.
For fruit tree use 800 – 1000 lit /ha.

Formulation:
Antracol 70 WP is a wettable powder containing 70 % ai /kg   Propineb.

Mode of action:
Propineb is a dithiocarbamate fungicide with the multisite activity characteristic of the group. Conidia or germinating conidia are killed by contact with propineb.

items.name: Atlantis OD 42
items.description:
Atlantis OD is a leading herbicide from Bayer CropScience for controlling all relevant grass weed and key dicots in wheat. It comes in the form of the novel and easy to use ODesi® liquid formulation offering high flexibility in managing different grass weeds or mixed infestations while the crop is safe due to the safener technology included. Atlantis OD is offered with a formulation technology that truly is a new dimension in herbicide (better retention, better spreading, better uptake and lower water volumes).

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor

How to apply:
- Shake the bottle well before use, fill half of the tank with water, add the product in correct dose rate then fill to the end while agitation of the whole spray liquid.
- For ground application use standard boom sprayer fixed on the tractors.
- Use water volume of 200 – 300 Lt./ha.
- Observe speed travel to be 6 – 8 Km/h and spray pressure (2.5-3 Bar) to grantee equal and good coverage.
- Atlantis OD does not need the addition of any adjuvant.

Formulation:
Atlantis 42 OD is an oil dispersion containing 10 g/l Mesosulfuron + 2 g/l Iodosulfuron + 30 g/l Mefenpyr –diethyl

Mode of action:
Mesosulfuron, Iodosulfuron is a sulfonyl urea herbicide , which are ALS inhibitors and have fully systemic activity on the target weeds – via both foliage & soil. The safener acts as a catalyst, specifically promoting the degradation of mesosulfuron and iodosulfuron in the cereal crop.

items.name: Betanal maxxPro 209 OD
items.description:
New sugar beet herbicide with a new patented formulation and activation technology. The result is superior weed control, outstanding crop safety and maxximum convenience.
BETANAL MAXXPRO is a broad-spectrum post-emergence contact/residual herbicide which controls a wide range of annual broad-leaved weeds and annual meadow-grass in sugar beet, and fodder beet.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor

How to apply:
Shake the bottle well before use, fill half of the tank with water, add the product in correct dose rate then fill to the end while agitation of the whole spray liquid. For ground application use standard boom sprayer fixed on the tractors. Use water volume of 80 – 130 Lt./fed. Observe speed travel to be 6 – 8 Km/h and spray pressure (2.5-3 Bar) to grantee equal and good coverage. BETANAL MAXXPRO does not need the addition of any adjuvant.

Formulation:
BETANAL MAXXPRO 209 is an oil dispersion containing 47 g ai /lit + Desmedipham + 60 g ai /lit Phenmedipham + 75 g ai /lit Ethofumesate +27 g ai / lit Lenacil.

Mode of action:
Desmedipham and Phenmedipham inhibiting Hill reaction in the photo-synthetic pathway while Ethofumesate stop cell division (mitosis) and Lenacil work as an activator.This cause severe stunted and deformed growth inhibition often resulting in a dark green coloration and leaf deformity and eventually become necrotic and die.

items.name: Bulldock SC 125
items.description:
Bulldock is an insecticide with a very good knockdown power and good residual activity at a very low dose rate. Bulldock acts as a contact and stomach poison and has a broad spectrum of activity against chewing insects (lepidopterous larvae), beetles and sucking insects.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor

How to apply:
foliar application for vegetables use 600-800 lit /ha according to plant size
For fruit trees use 800-1000 lit /ha to ensure good coverage

Formulation:
Bulldock 125 SC is a suspension concentrate containing 125g a.i/l. Beta-Cyfluthrin

Mode of action:
Beta-cyfluthrin acts by contact and ingestion. It acts on the insect’s nervous system as sodium channel blocker.

items.name: Calypso 480 SC
items.description:
Calypso is a Systimic contact insecticide that has been developed by BCS mainly for foliar applications providing effective control of a broad spectrum of sucking and chewing pests. It has better activity against certain Lepidopteran pests. Calypso acts as an acute contact and stomach poison, combining systemic properties with relatively low application rates and superior plant compatibility. Calypso is a new tool for resistance management in apple codling moth control and where organo-phosphates, carbamates and pyrethroids have been traditionally used.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
foliar application for vegetables use 600-800 lit /ha according to plant size
For fruit trees use 800-1000 lit /ha to ensure good coverage.

Formulation:
Calypso 480 SC is a suspension concentrate containing 480 g/l thiacloprid.

Mode of action:
Calypso selectively binds to the postsynaptic nicotinergic receptor, thus disturbing signal transmission in the insect’s nervous system. Due to this mode of action, there is no cross resistance to conventional insecticides. This mode of action is different from organo-phosphates, carbamates and pyrethroids.

items.name: Confidor 200 OD
items.description:
Confidor is the first compound of the group of active ingredients from the chloronicotinyl insecticides (syn. neonicotinoids).  Confidor has an acute, contact and stomach effect and has a mode of action, different to organophosphates, carbamates and pyrethroids, acting on the same target side as acetylcholine receptor agonists.
Confidor has an excellent systemic and broad-spectrum activity combined with low application rates and long-lasting efficacy. Confidor can be applying by:  foliar, soil and stem application particularly against sucking insects for fruits, vegetables, grapes and arable crops.

How to apply:
foliar application use 300-400 lit /fed according to plant size to ensure good coverage.

Formulation:
Oil Dispersion  (OD) containing 200 gr.a.i./ Lt. Imidacloprid.

items.name: Consento SC 450
items.description:
Consento 450 SC is a fungicide product offering reliably, high level of late and early blight control. It combines the strengths of two active ingredients exhibiting both translaminar and systemic properties resulting in consistent preventive and curative efficacy. The product is well adapted to respond to the most severe situations by protecting the foliage, stem and tuber of plants during periods of new growth. High yield and quality of produce as well as safety of workers, the environment and the consumers is ensured.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
foliar application use 600-800 lit /ha to ensure good coverage.

Formulation:
Consento 450 SC is a soluble concentrate containing propamocarb hydrochloride 375 g/l + fenamidone 75 g/l.

Mode of action:
Fenamidone acts by disturbing the transmission of energy in the pathogen's mitochondria. It inhibits mitochondrial respiration by. Its high level of activity against zoospore liberation and direct cyst and sporangial germination ensures consistently good preventive efficacy. It also exhibits curative and antisporulant effects due to a partial translaminar penetration into the leaves.
Propamocarb HCl reduces mycelial growth and development of sporangia and (zoo)spores by influencing the biochemical synthesis of fungal cell membranes.

items.name: Decis EC 25
items.description:
Decis, is one of the oldest and very successful BCS product. The success of Decis, is based on two pillars: its extraordinary features, such as broad spectrum, multi-crop and quick knock-down effect, and its excellent awareness in the global agricultural world. Decis, is a non-systemic insecticide which acts by contact and ingestion to sucking and chewing insects. Its high lipophilicity provides a high affinity with the insect cuticle. 
-Fast knockdown.
 -Broad spectrum. 
-Multi-crop. 
-Unique chemistry based on one isomer.
 -Easy to mix  - very good tank-mix ability.
 -Low rates per hectare.
 -Low operator impact.
 -Low PHI.
 -Broad coverage of MRLs and import tolerances.
 -High crop compatibility.
 -Selective to many Beneficial’s.
 -Proven efficacy for 30 years.
 -Established molecule.
 -Low costs.
 -Quickly breakdown in soil.
 -Safe for the environment and to consumers.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

 How to apply:
foliar application for vegetables use 600-800 lit /ha according to plant sizeFor fruit trees use 800-1000 lit /ha to ensure good coverage.

Formulation:
Decis EC 25 is an emulsifable concentrate containing 25 g/l deltamethrin.

Mode of action:
Decis works by preventing the transmission of nervous impulses along nerve fibres, thereby disrupting the pest’s nervous system, resulting in death.

items.name: Envidor SC 240
items.description:
Envidor is an absolutely outstanding solution for mite control in citrus, apples, pears and grapes. A non-systemic foliar acaricide. The product convinces through the broad spectrum and good performance under difficult weather conditions. It is suitable for IPM - programs. A broad number international import tolerance makes it easy to commercialize the yielded crops. Envidor shows good to excellent efficacy against all developmental stages of mites, including eggs as well as reduces female fertility. 
-novel chemistry with unique Mode of Action. 
-provides long lasting control. 
-excellent margins of safety.  
-great flexibility in use, outstanding control of all important mites. 
-PHI‘s appropriate for growers needs. 
-miticide with superior value in target crops. 
-control/suppression (depends on timing) of psylla, leafhoppers and scales.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
foliar application use 800 -1000 lit /fed according to plant size to ensure good Coverage.

Formulation:
Envidor 240 SC is a suspension concentrate containing 240 g a.i. / l spirodiclofen.

Mode of action:
Spirodiclofen, inhibiting lipid synthesis, and does not show any cross resistance to other current acaricides and this makes spirodiclofen an attractive alternative for the control of harmful mites.

items.name: Equip 22.5 OD
items.description:
Equip is a new post emergence herbicide used for the control of annual and perennial grass and broad leaved weeds in corn. Equip is very broad spectrum, strongly crop-safe, extremely rain fast, and fields can be replanted with virtually any crop in normal cropping rotations. Equip has also the “built-in” Corn Safener Technology which ensures the highest level of crop selectivity without compromising herbicidal efficacy.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor

How to apply:
Shake the bottle well before use, fill half of the tank with water, add the product in correct dose rate then fill to the end while agitation of the whole spray liquid.
For ground application use standard boom sprayer fixed on the tractors.
Use water volume of 80 – 130 Lt./fed.
Observe speed travel to be 6 – 8 Km/h and spray pressure (2.5-3 Bar) to grantee equal and good coverage
EQUIP OD does not need the addition of any adjuvant.

Formulation:
Equip 22.5 OD is an oil dispersion containing 22.5 g foramsulfuron per liter.

Mode of action:
Foramsulfuron acts on the target weeds both via the foliage and the soil, with a predominance of foliar action. After uptake the substance shows limited translocation to parts not treated. Susceptible plants cease to grow almost immediately after post-emergence application and symptoms are the appearance of chlorotic patches, followed by slow shoot necrosis. Weeds will be completely killed 1 to 4 weeks after application.

items.name: Ethrel 480 SL
items.description:
Ethrel , containing the active substance ethephon, is a plant growth regulator The product is registered in more than 60 countries worldwide such as Australia, Brazil, France, Germany, Greece and USA on about 60 crops, including cereals, cotton, various fruits, pineapple, rubber trees and sugar cane. Ethrel is used for thinning, loosening or ripening in various crops.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

Formulation:
Ethrel  480 SL is a soluble liquid concentrate containing  480 g.a.i. /l Ethephon.

Mode of action:
Ethephon is absorbed by the plant tissues where it is broken down into naturally occurring compounds: carbon dioxide, phosphate and also ethylene, which acts as a plant hormone.

items.name: Flint WG 50
items.description:
Flint fungicide is a unique strobilurin with an unsurpassed mode of action: THE MESOSTEMIC POWER “Mesostemic power” means: 
-strong activity on the plant surface. 
-strong redistribution effect via vapor phase and surface water. 
-good rainfastness, long residual control. 
-penetration into the leaf tissue. 
-translaminar activity. 
Flint provides a high level of broad spectrum preventive activity and excellent curative activity for specific pathogens. Flint target diseases are: powdery mildew, early blight grape black rot and apple scab.  
Flint has good side effect against downy mildew and botrytis The product is strongly absorbed by the waxy layers of the plant and provides excellent preventive activity, and insures higher yields and excellent fruit quality.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
foliar application use 600-800 lit /ha according to plant size to ensure good coverage.

Formulation:
Flint 50 WG is a water dispersible granule containing 500g/kg trifloxystrobin.

Mode of action:
Flint 50 WG is a contact fungicide with penetrating properties. Consist is a respiration inhibitor, in the mitochondria of fungal cells. It inhibits early stages in the disease cycle
Spore germination and formation of appressoria (e.g. Powdery mildews, apple Scab).

items.name: Folicur EC 250
items.description:
Folicur is a fungicidal compound with a broad-spectrum systemic action which can be used as a foliar spray or seed-dressing. Folicur has excellent plant compatibility and provide reliable efficacy over a period of several weeks and controls numerous pathogens in various crops. The wide spectrum of activity covers the following pathogens: 
-alternaria, fusarium, helminthosporium, monilia, mycosphaerella, powdery mildew, rusts, sclerotinia, septoria, venturia, and many more. 
Main focus 
-cereals:
fusarium & rusts. 
-peanuts: white rot. 
-stonefruits: monilia. 
-vegetables: leaf spots. 
-grapes: powdery mildew. 

Folicur is the standard fungicide that can do almost any job. It may not be the best for each individual disease, but it is often the best all-round solution.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
foliar application use 600-800 lit /ha according to plant size to ensure good coverage.

Formulation:
Folicur 250 EC is an emulsifiable concentrate containing 250g/l tebuconazole.

Mode of action:
Tebuconazole is a fungicidal triazole compound that acts as a demethylation inhibitor (DMI) of fungal sterol biosynthesi.

items.name: Gaucho WS 70 ROT
items.description:
A seed treatment product with excellent systemic properties acting through the roots, ensuring protection of the plant against pests from the time of sowing well into the growing period. It has a broad spectrum of activity, particularly against sucking pests. In the soil, the active ingredient is released from the seed and forms a treatment-halo around the seed. Gaucho is absorbed very efficiently by the germinating plant and is transported in the sap-flow to the stem and leaves. Gaucho fits very well in IPM-systems and the grower is minimally exposed.

How to apply:
Seed treatment before plantation
Seeds should be dry and free of soil deposits and clean at treatment.

Formulation:
Gaucho WS 70 is a water dispersible containing 700 g a.i/kg imidacloprid.

Mode of action: 
Imidacloprid acts as acute contact and stomach poison. Extremely high binding affinity with insect nicotinergic acetylcholine-receptors leading to insect’s death usually within 24 - 48 hours.

items.name: Infinito SC 687.5
items.description:
Infinito 687.5 SC is a fungicide exhibiting best-in-class efficacy against Late Blight in potato combining powerful and consistent disease control. Results are long-lasting with antisporulant activity and curative potential along with built-in resistance management by combining two active ingredients with different modes of action. It can be used in IPM systems and fits well with irrigation programs due to very good rainfastness. It is a convenient tool facilitating the production of high quality crops with excellent marketability. Infinito 687.5 SC has a favorable food chain profile, short PHI and established set of international MRLs.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
foliar application use 600-800 lit /ha according to plant size to ensure good coverage.

Formulation:
Infinito 68,75 SC is a soluble concentrate containing propamocarb hydrochloride 625g/l + fluopicolide  62.5 g/l.

Mode of action:
Fluopicolide shows very quick and unique action and interferes with several stages in the synthesis of phospho-lipids and fatty acids, thus disrupting the formation of fungal cell membranes. Propamocarb affects the mycelium growth, the spore production and the spore germination.

items.name: Luna Experience 400 SC
items.description:
Luna Experience is a new fungicide with a different mode of action than competition for a broad spectrum of foliar diseases:
-Powdery mildew.
-Rust.
-Spot diseases.
-Purple blotch.
-Stemphilium.
-Apple scab.
-Monilia.
-Sclerotinia (White mold).
-Grey mold.

Luna Experience  is multi-crop fungicide product a for grapes, fruit and vegetables.
Luna Experience has excellent efficacy at low dose rates, curative and protective properties and can be a tool for proactive resistance management.

Luna Experience benefits:
-Improved quality.
-Longer shelf-life.
-Better storability due to reduction of postharvest losses.
-Increased marketability.
-Reduced fungicide applications.
-Increase the volume of marketable fruit.

How to apply:
foliar application For Cucumber and onion use 300 - 400 lit /fed according to plant size to ensure good coverage
For Grape : use400 - 600 lit /fed according to plant size to ensure good coverage.

Formulation:
Luna Experience  400 SC is a soluble concentrate containing 200 gr a.i/l .Fluopyram + 200 g a.i /l  Tebuconazol.

Mode of action:
Fluopyram blocks (inhibits) the succinate dehydrogenase, Complex II of the fungi’s respiratory chain.

items.name: MaisTer power 57.5 OD
items.description:
MaisTer power combines three active ingredients along with one innovative safener providing to the grower the best all-in-one solution for weed control in corn for the whole of the season. This ready to use product performs reliably while providing flexibility to the grower. MaisTer power is a post-emergence herbicide used for the control of annual and perennial grass and broad-leaved weeds, including residual control. It is a very broad-spectrum, crop-safe and rapidly rainfast.

How to apply:
For best coverage apply in 80 - 120 l/fed water.
Apply when wind is low to reduce drift.
Apply when the weeds are young and actively growing.

Formulation:
MaisTer is an oil dispersion containing
31,5 g/l Foramsulfuron + 1,0 g/l Iodosulfuron +10 g/l Thiencarbazone + 15 g/l Cyprosulfamide.

Mode of action:
MaisTer power is targeting the aceto-hydroxy-acid-synthase enzyme (AHAS=ALS)in weeds plant . The visible symptoms of herbicidal action are arrested growth in the first few days after application and the appearance of chlorotic patches, followed by slow shoot necrosis, and then plants die.

items.name: Mesurol 2 RB
items.description:
Mesurol 2 RB is a high quality molluscicide pellet which is resistant to weather conditions and mould. Mesurol 2 RB consistently delivers the highest levels of mollusc control across all species. The product safeguards plants not only against damage from snail feeding; it also protects them from contamination with the slime secreted by these pests as well as their faeces.

Compatibility:
Not applicable as bait application.

How to apply:
distribute the bait evenly in infested area

Formulation:
Mesurol 2 RB is a ready to use bait containing 2g a.i. /kg  methiocarb.

Mode of action:
Mesurol  acts as a non-systemic contact and stomach poison. It is a fast-acting product and shows good residual activity. Its molluscicidal activity is based on its inhibition of acetylcholinesterase, in a similar way as the organophosphorus compounds.

items.name: Monceren 25 WP
items.description:
Monceren is a non-systemic, protective fungicide with long-lasting activity, when used as a seed treatment or when applied to the soil, the product exhibits excellent efficacy against potato black scurf and stem canker diseases. Monceren controls emergence diseases as well as seedling and stem diseases The a.i. has no effect on potato flavour and leaves no unpleasant smell.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
Seed treatment before plantation
Potato Tubers should be dry and free of soil deposits at treatment.

Formulation:
Monceren 25 WP is a wettable powder containing 250 g.ai./ kg Pencycuron.

Mode of action:
Pencycuron is a lipophilic active ingredient which penetrates into the plant cuticle; from here it acting by inhibiting mycelium growth of fungi.

items.name: Monceren G 370 FS
items.description:
Monceren G New Seed treatment fungicide / insecticide Mixture of two active ingredients. A   non-systemic, protective fungicide with long-lasting activity, as well as a systemic insecticide with excellent performance against sucking insects Monceren G is used for protecting potato from sucking pest (Aphids) and Black scurf (Rhizocotonia) and it is ideal for integrated crop protection and resistance management. When applied as a preventive treatment, its highly specific action prevents the invading fungus from spreading further. Monceren G Produces more consistent tuber size and shape and clean, bright skin finish.

How to apply: 
-Shake the container well before use and re-seal immediately after use.
 -Seed Tubers should be dry and free of soil deposits at treatment. 
-Seed tubers may be treated with Monceren G at any time going out of store.
 -Application should be carried out over a roller table, most conveniently at the end of grading and before planting -Monceren G may be applied as spray (at up to 3.0 litres of spray solution per tonne), or on Planter application.

Formulation: Monceren G 370FS is a flowable concentrate for seed treatment, containing 250 g.ai./ kg Pencycuron + 120 g a.i /kg Imidacloprid.

Mode of action: Imidacloprid acts as acute contact and stomach poison with an excellent systemic and broad-spectrum activity against sucking pests .Pencycuron is a non-systemic, protective fungicide with long-lasting activity inhibiting mycelium growth of fungi.

items.name: Movento 100 SC
items.description:
Movento is a new 2-way-systemic insecticide for the control of sucking pests mainly for fruits and vegetables. With Movento you need to spray to the leaves. Movento has a broad spectrum of activity against many sucking insects with a very long lasting efficacy: 
-Aphids. 
-Thrips. 
-Psyllids. 
-Mealy bugs. 
-Whiteflies. 
-Scale insects. 
-Even suppression of mites, fruit flies & nematodes.

Movento is developed globally in a wide range of crops such as: Vegetables, Citrus, Pome- & Stone-fruits, Nuts, Grape, Hops, Potato, Tropical fruits, Cotton & Soybean. 
-Movento is Environmentally Safe and harmless to adult pollinators such as honey bees or Bumblebees and has a very favorable ecotoxicological profile. 
-Movento has no cross-resistance, even in aphids & whiteflies. 
-Movento can be an important tool for Effective Resistance Management.

How to apply: 
Apply Movento to the leaves 
-foliar application for vegetables use 600 - 800 lit /ha according to plant size to ensure good coverage. 
-foliar application for fruit trees use 800 - 1000 lit /fed according to tree size.

Formulation: 
Movento 100 SC is a suspension concentrate containing 100 g a.i. /l Spirotetramat.

Mode of action: 
Movento has a very strong two way systemic activity and inhibiting lipid biosynthesis especially triglycerides and free fatty acids.

items.name: Nativo WG 75
items.description:
Nativo is a new fungicide contains of two tried-and-trusted active ingredients with protective and curative activity. It has an excellent effect against Powdery mildew and a broad spectrum disease control for grapes, vegetables and fruits: 
-Alternaria,  
-Anthracnose,  
-Stemphylium,  
-Cladosporium,  
-Rust 
-Black rot on grapes 
-Botrytis suppression

Nativo benefits are: 
-Protective and curative activity 
-High and long
-lasting efficacy 
-Flexible application timing 
-Built-in anti-resistance management 
-Widely established MRLs -Product of choice for food chain partners 
-Beneficial effects on plant health, yield and quality

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor

How to apply:
foliar application For vegetables use 600- 800 lit /ha according to plant size
For Fruit trees : use 800 - 1000 lit /ha according to plant size to ensure good coverage

Formulation:
NATIVO 75 WG is a convenient granular contains 25% Trifloxystrobin and 50% Tebuconazole .

Mode of action:
Tebuconazole has a systemic action and acts as a demethylation inhibitor (DMI) of fungal sterol biosynthesis.Trifloxystrobin acts as a respiration inhibitor by blocking the electron transfer at fungal mitochondrial membrane.

items.name: Oberon SC 240
items.description:
Oberon, a non-systemic foliar insecticide / acaricide belongs to a chemical class developed by Bayer: ketoenols. Due to this innovative “ketoenol technology,” Oberon provides a new mode of action for whitefly and spider mite (Tetranychus) control, and shows no cross-resistance to current acaricides and insecticides. Oberon has a high level of long-lasting efficacy. Yet, with its excellent environmental profile and friendliness to Beneficial’s and pollinators, Oberon fits with IPM programs. 

Excellent efficacy against eggs and larvae of the whitefly. Adult female whitefly shows a significant decrease in fertility and in the number of eggs laid. Whitefly highly resistant to conventional insecticides are not cross-resistant to Oberon. All developmental stages of Spidermites and adults (except males) are controlled.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
foliar application for vegetables use 600-800 lit /ha according to plant size.

Formulation:
Oberon 240 SC is a suspension concentrate containing 240 g a.i. /l Spiromesifen.

Mode of action:
Oberon acts by contact activity and inhibiting lipid biosynthesis especially triglycerides and free fatty acids. These make spiromesifen a valuable tool for resistance management.

items.name: Previcur Energy SL 840
items.description:
Previcur Energy is a new systemic fungicide with protective action. It is a new synthesized molecule.
Previcur Energy offers enhanced efficacy along with excellent crop tolerance against:
-Soil diseases for all vegetables: Pythium, Phytophthora. (Seedbed drench and Drip application)
-Bremia in Lettuce (Foliar application).
-Downy mildew in cucurbits (Foliar application)

Previcur Energy is easy to use (Drip application, Drench, Spray) and show root and growth stimulant effect.
Previcur Energy two different modes of action offers enhanced resistance management.

How to apply:
Drench mix 250 ml /100 lit water then add 20-25 ml from solution to each planting hall.
foliar application For use 600 - 800 lit /ha according to plant size.

Formulation type:
Drench mix 250 ml /100 lit water then add 20-25 ml from solution to each planting hall.
foliar application For use 300 - 400 lit /fed according to plant size.

Formulation:
Previcur Energy 840 SL is a soluble liquid concentrate containing 53% a.i./ l. propamocarb hydrochloride + 31% a.i./l Fosetyl.

Mode of action:
-Propamocarb disrupts the formation of fungal cell membranes and Affects mycelial growth, spore production and spore germination of the fungi.
-Fosetyl with Systemic effect stimulates the plants’ natural defense and stop spore germination and penetration into the plant.

items.name: Previcur N 72
items.description:
Previcur N is a systemic fungicide used worldwide for the effective control of many soil and foliar pathogens such as (Phytophthora, Pythium, Bremia, Peronospora, pseudoperonospora) in vegetables and ornamentals. It also demonstrates growth stimulating properties. 
-Previcur N with its complete systemic activity gives vigorous protection to the seeds and seedling against root disease. 
-Previcur N enhances root system and the plant growth is significantly improved. 
-Previcur N works as protective and curative with long lasting efficacy.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
Drench 200-250 ml /100 lit water then add 20-25 ml from solution to each planting hall.
foliar application For use 300 - 400 lit /fed according to plant size.

Formulation:
Previcur N 72 SL is a soluble liquid concentrate containing 72.2% a.i./ l. propamocarb hydrochloride.

Mode of action:
Disrupts the formation of fungal cell membranes and affects mycelial growth, spore production and spore germination.

items.name: Puma Super 7.5 EW
items.description:
Puma Super is wheat herbicide used to control a broad spectrum of grass weeds in in many countries across the world. It is fast acting and offers a high level of efficacy over a wide window of application. Puma Super is safe to the crop with no follow crop restrictions and the grower can benefit from a wide choice of tank-mix options.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
-For ground application use standard boom sprayer fixed on the tractors.
-Use water volume of 120 – 200 Lt./fed.
-Apply when wind is low to reduce drift.
-Apply when the weeds are young and actively growing.

Formulation:
Puma Super EW 7.5 %  is an oil in water emulsion containing 69 g/l fenoxaprop-p-ethyl.

Mode of action:
inhibits the biosynthesis of fatty acids leading to plant death. For the application in cereal crops, the fenoxaprop –P-ethyl formulation contains the safener mepenpyr-diethyl which absorbed by foliage and in cereals, enhances the rate of metabolism of fenoxaprop P- ethyl in cereals plant to non-phytotoxic products.

items.name: Raxil FS 25
items.description:
Raxil protects against seed and soil-borne diseases of wheat and ensures good quality harvests. Applied as a seed treatment means that there is low active ingredient input which is friendly to the environment and a cost effective investment for the grower. Raxil is taken up by plants and transported acropetally. Raxil used as a seed dressing controls pathogens that are present inside the seed as well as those adhering to its outer surface. Used in cereals against smut and bunt diseases (Tilletia caries, Urocystis spp. and Ustilago spp.) and against seed-borne Septoria nodorum; and in sorghum and maize, also against seed- and soil-borne Sphacelotheca spp.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
-Seed treatment before plantation.
-Seed should be dry and free of soil deposits at treatment.

Formulation:
Raxil FS 25 is a flowable concentrate for seed treatment, containing 25 g.ai./ l tebuconazole.

Mode of action:
Tebuconazole acts as a demethylation inhibitor (DMI) of fungal sterol biosynthesis.

items.name: Ronstar 25 EC
items.description:
Ronstar is a contact herbicide used across the world and has excellent pre- and post-emergence activity against weeds in families such as: Graminaceae, Amaranthaceae, Chenopodiaceae and Euphorbiaceae.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor

How to apply:
-Shake the bottle well before use, fill half of the tank with water, add the product in correct dose rate then fill to the end while agitation of the whole spray liquid.
-For ground application use standard boom sprayer fixed on the tractors.
-Use water volume of 200 – 400 Lt./ha.
-Observe speed travel to be 6 – 8 Km/h and spray pressure (2.5-3 Bar) to grantee equal and good coverage.

Formulation:
Ronstar 25 EC is an emulsifiable concentrate containing 250 g/l oxadiazon.

Mode of action:
Pre-emergence effects are obtained at germination by contact with oxadiazon-treated soil particles. The development of the shoots is stopped as soon as they emerge - their tissues decay very rapidly and the plant is killed. When the soil is very dry, the pre-emergence activity is greatly reduced. Post-emergence effect is obtained by absorption through aerial parts of weeds which are rapidly killed in the presence of light. The treated tissues wither and dry out.

items.name: Sencor 60 SC
items.description:
Sencor is a selective herbicide that shows good effects against a broad range of annual grass and broad-leaved weeds. It is used across the world in many different crops, including alfalfa, cereals, potatoes, soybeans, sugar cane and vegetables. Sencor is suitable for pre-emergence as well as for post-emergence treatment, since it is systemic, taken up via the roots and through the foliage. For a pre-emergence application there should be an adequate amount of moisture in the soil to achieve good weed control. Sencor has No limitations regarding re-cropping.

How to apply: 
-For ground application use standard boom sprayer fixed on the tractors. 
-Use water volume of 120 – 200 Lt./fed.
 -Apply when wind is low to reduce drift. 
-Apply when the weeds are young and actively growing.

Formulation:
 Sencor 60 SC is a suspension concentrate containing 600 g.ai./ kg  metribuzin.

Mode of action: 
Metribuzin is herbicide acting as an inhibitor of photosynthesis. Due to its root- and leaf-systemicity, metribuzin can be used as a pre- and postemergence herbicide. If used in pre-emergence, metribuzin relies on the presence of moisture in the soil for broad spectrum weed control. Soil properties influence the herbicidal efficacy and crop tolerance of metribuzin. High contents in clay and/or humus need higher application rates.

items.name: Sereno 60 WG
items.description:
Sereno 60 WG offers double protection to crops against late blight as well as strong control of early blight in one go. It combines two active ingredients and acts fast in a consistent and reliable way resulting in high level of efficacy protecting new leaves and stems. 
Sereno is showing good protectant activity against leaf blight, early blight and tuber blight. It also exhibits anti-sporulant effects. 
Sereno has an Excellent protectant, Antisporulant, curative and translaminar activity and show no risk for beneficial, birds and bees.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
Foliar application For use 300 - 400 lit /fed according to plant size.

Formulation:
Sereno 60 WG is a water dispersible granule containing fenamidone 100 g/kg + mancozeb 500 g/kg.

Mode of action:
Fenamidone inhibits mitochondrial respiration by blocking electron transport. Its high level of activity against zoospore liberation and direct cyst and sporangial germination ensures consistently good preventative efficacy in the control of vine downy mildew and late blight of potatoes and tomatoes. Fenamidone has curative and antisporulant effects as well as a secondary effect on the first stages of development of the mycelium. Mancozeb is a preventative multisite fungicide of the family of Dithiocarbamates that inhibits germination of mildew zoospores. It acts on several metabolisms in the fungus.Mancozeb is a preventative multisite fungicide that inhibits germination of mildew zoospores.

items.name: Teldor SC 500
items.description:
Teldor, as a nonsystemic protective fungicide, is notable mainly for its: 
- excellent efficacy against Botrytis. 
- Good to very good efficacy against Monilinia spp. 
- Good to very good efficacy against Sclerotinia. 
These fungal diseases, especially as the causative organisms of various types of fruit mould, such as grey and brown rot, are among the major pathogens of: 
- Grapes.  
- Pome  and Stone fruit. 
- Indoor vegetables like tomato, pepper and cucurbits. 
- Strawberries, Bulbs, legumes and ornamental plants. 
Teldor works by contact. Teldor forms a stable protective layer on various parts of the plant; the layer is hardly reduced at all by washing, penetration or systemic translocation. As a result, Teldor offers very effective and long-lasting protection. The pathogen is halted on the plant at the most sensitive stage of its development, before it has a chance to penetrate the plant tissue.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
foliar application For vegetables use 600 - 800 lit /ha according to plant size
For Fruit trees: use 800 - 1000 lit /ha according to plant size to ensure good coverage.

Formulation:
Teldor 500 SC is a suspension concentrate containing 500 g. ai./ Fenhexamid.

Mode of action:
Fenhexamid is a strong inhibitor of germ tube growth preventing penetration of the fungus into the plant tissue resulting in death of the fungus.

items.name: Whip super 7.5 EW
items.description:
Whip Super, works as a selective herbicide for mid- and late-post emergence control of grass weeds and once in the soil, the compound is quickly broken down into biologically inactive degradation products.  Whip Super is used at very low application rates to control a broad grass weed spectrum with high level of efficacy and Very fast acting.

Compatibility:
Consult the local label/distributor.

How to apply:
-In water seeded rice, it is necessary to allow drainage of water after application, that the active ingredient can be bound at the soil surface.
-For ground application use standard boom sprayer fixed on the tractors.
-Use water volume of 120 – 200 Lt./fed.
-Apply when wind is low to reduce drift.
-Apply when the weeds are young and actively growing.

Formulation:
Whip Super EW 7.5 % is an oil in water emulsion containing 75 g/l fenoxaprop-p-ethyl.

Mode of action:
Fenoxaprop-P-ethyl is absorbed by leaves and stems of plants and is translocated systemically. It predominantly inhibits the synthesis of fatty acids in the meristem tissue of grass weeds. Necrosis at the growing points leads to cessation of growth, chlorosis of the leaves and death within1 to 2 weeks, depending on environmental conditions.
